title: When your friends try to play the champion you main and feed

replies.body: I main {{champion:75}}. It kills me inside to see people building {{item:3074}} and having 200 stacks by 30 minutes.
{{item:3072}} is better if you're going for lifesteal

> [{quoted}](name=Sirsir94,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-05-28T18:31:13.728+0000)
>
> {{item:3072}} is better if you're going for lifesteal

No, you don't even NEED Lifesteal. Just build Spirit Visage, Trinity Force, then full tank.

> [{quoted}](name=PalPlays,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-28T19:32:19.548+0000)
>
> No, you don't even NEED Lifesteal. Just build Spirit Visage, Trinity Force, then full tank.

So you are not gonna build {{item:3110}}

uh... *full tank*.

{{item:3110}} is a tank item, sooo...

Building full tank means you can build {{item:3110}}.

> [{quoted}](name=junglerboy16,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-28T20:50:05.945+0000)
>
> uh... *full tank*.
> 
> {{item:3110}} is a tank item, sooo...
> 
> Building full tank means you can build {{item:3110}}.

Yeah but like usually you rush frozen heart first cuz it provides mana and armor.
Sorry i misunderstood

You don't understand...
People build Frozen Heart for the cooldown reduction.
If Frozen Heart provided more armor and mana, but zero CDR, no Nasus player would buy it.

Seriously, what yorkie said. CD-R is the absolute best damage stat for Nasus. Getting q stacks more often gives damage that is a permanent boost, and you'll get that tri eventually so you end up with more damage rushing CDR

i like a last item {{item:3035}}

edit - i dont get trinity though

> [{quoted}](name=ChaoticPinecone,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2015-05-28T21:10:08.034+0000)
>
> i like a last item {{item:3035}}
> 
> edit - i dont get trinity though

for the last item i usually get infinity edge for crits on Q

Crit don't apply to the q damage, just the auto part of q

also on the subject, instead of getting {{item:3035}}, the new BC gives 20% CDR...

i take flat CDR blues (7.5%) + 5% in the offensive tree for faster stacks early. You cap out with a frozen heart and spirit visage. 

and i feel that nasus has a hard time getting BC stacks on a single target, much less multiple.
why 7.5% and not 5%?

Nasus only has trouble farming his Q early, where it has a 8 second cooldown. starting the game with 12.5% CDR helps that out without gimping yourself (you could theoretically start with 17.5% CDR if you went 9-0-21). 

you will be over the limit by 2.5% CDR after your core items, but to me its not that big of a deal.
I like {{item:3025}} on Nasus, not that I am great with him, but seems to do the trick for me.
I'll buy that if I have 600 stacks by 30 just for shits and giggles.
But mah damages!

> [{quoted}](name=Sirsir94,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-05-28T18:31:13.728+0000)
>
> {{item:3072}} is better if you're going for lifesteal

Nasus' passive Soul eater gives him 10-15-20% innate life steal... really hope this was a joke.
but thats the point. youre tanky from your items/ult, do insane single target damage with enough stacks, and now you can livesteal tank everything too (lifesteal benefits from your stacks.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaoticPinecone,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2015-05-28T21:12:33.531+0000)
>
> but thats the point. youre tanky from your items/ult, do insane single target damage with enough stacks, and now you can livesteal tank everything too (lifesteal benefits from your stacks.

Nasus have enough innate Lifesteal as is. Going full tank with Spirit Visage actually let's you heal MORE than if you got more lifesteal.

we are talking about one offensive item here

most people go trinity, but besides the sheen proc and the movespeed its not too useful. it provides negligible amounts of health and mana. and he doesnt benefit from the attack speed. 

you would still go spirit visage/frozen heart/randiuns/thornmail or something to that effect on the rest of your items, maybe switching out the thornmail for a banshees in a 2-3 AP comp or going warmogs if they have an ADC like Corki. But if you choose to go 1 offensive item, you have plenty of choices - Iceborn for the slow/sheen, last whisper to nuke tanks. ive seen lifesteal Nasus work before. its impossible to fight through both the tanky items and the insane lifesteal - the only way to win is to kite.
I think people probably go trinity force over bt because the prerequisite items give him some health and mana. If you go BT, you're squishier for longer and go oom faster.
I should clarify that you get BT as your one offensive item, in place of Trin Force

Really?
I thought he was supposed to buy {{item:3041}} first. :/
Followed by {{item:3091}} .

XD

I have my own build and at 20 I get 400 to 600 stacks
lolking.net/guides/317704

I laugh so hard when enemies have like 68 stacks at 20 xD
Fighter Nasus. don't go early game Ravenous, but get you Q farm up first with BT or Phage/Black Cleaver. Job jobbed.

Did you just...e...then...q...as Anivia...
The waste of mana and potential...oh the humanity...
*faints*

Me when watching Vi players play.

"No, don't ult the Fizz..."

"Why the fuck are you building assassin against a tanky comp."

"Don't Q at the Soraka!"

"If you're going to rush cinderhulk, don't get sheen immediately! Get phage dammit!"

"Why the hell did you get mobi boots?"

"Why are you maxing W???"

"Did you just ult the tank in a teamfight...?"

"She has zhonyas—aaaaand you ulted her. Dammit."

"Ult the mobile assassin BEFORE they blink, dammit!"

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-05-28T21:30:11.007+0000)

>

> 
> "She has zhonyas—aaaaand you ulted her. Dammit."
> 
> "Ult the mobile assassin BEFORE they blink, dammit!"


But mobility boots makes me happy. ;-;

Don't worry, it's personal preference. :3

I just don't like mobi boots because cinderhulk or sunfire's cape (good items on Vi!) will make traveling through the jungle, by lanes, through champions... you get it.

Besides, {{item:3009}} is amazing for her Q. But don't spread that around, it's a secret Vi thing >.>
Uh... what's wrong with maxing w? If vi wants to focus more on her early q it's great to max early, I think there are quite a few cases where it can be useful.

If you are going for bursting people maxing q is better. If you need to be more mobile, maxing q is better. Maxing w first is better only if the enemy has so much armor which isn't the case most of the time early game anyway.

But what about a situation where you don't want to gank very much and instead focus on clears, or where you end up dueling the enemy jungler frequently? Three hits is not too hard to get since she comes with a free aa reset. I agree q is generally better but I don't think w or e should just be dismissed.

Q is still better for it's high base damage. The only reason you would ever max e second (never first) is if you got a really early trinity so you have a lower cd on e charges for more trinity procs. However, her e gains very little damage from leveling it so maxing it first is a no go. Her w would have one foreseeable reason to max it first imo, taking dragons by yourself early and quickly. Her q really isn't that useful for clearing drag since it has a beefy cooldown. Q is better for most dueling cases though unless you just aren't good at landing it. I suppose w would be better for dueling early if you had a fed enemy tank jungler, but that could be avoided in most cases with good warding and killer counter ganks from your high damage q.
ok fair enough, BUT. What about toplane vi? Against someone who can kite you, e is your only form of ranged spell.

The damage of e alone is not enough to harass someone out of lane with the shockwaves. You would need to burst them out and to do that you must close the gap. Top lane vi vs a ranged champ works by instilling fear into your lane opponent, which you won't do with harass from your e.

W is better in late-game when people have more armor, making it easier for the adc to shred the tank (bruisers still need to protect their squishies!)

Q, especially when jungling, offers better ganks. Unless you build attack speed on Vi, you're not guaranteed to get three autoattacks in during a gank unless they're cc'd, so the Q damage is more reliable. You *can* max W second, but I tend to go for E for higher burst during ganks.

They think {{item:3074}}  applies on hit effects.

http://media0.giphy.com/media/17RaL7HOgI1CE/giphy.gif
HEY HEY HEY HEY!!!! If you're going to play as my main man {{champion:90}}, at least do me the favor of being good as him! Please?

While we're discussing Nasus, I have a friend who plays a lot of Nasus in Diamond... Sheen{{item:3057}}  is a great item to get early to build stacks, as well as early cooldown reduction (Iceborn Gauntlet {{item:3025}}  is a fun one, as well as Frozen heart{{item:3110}} , Spirit visage{{item:3065}} , etc.)

> [{quoted}](name=Silverboy79,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-05-28T22:29:15.031+0000)
>
> While we're discussing Nasus, I have a friend who plays a lot of Nasus in Diamond... Sheen{{item:3057}}  is a great item to get early to build stacks, as well as early cooldown reduction (Iceborn Gauntlet {{item:3025}}  is a fun one, as well as Frozen heart{{item:3110}} , Spirit visage{{item:3065}} , etc.)

I don't think Gauntlet is a good idea

> [{quoted}](name=SweetPotato233,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-05-28T23:57:38.414+0000)
>
> I don't think Gauntlet is a good idea

It provides a slowing field, as well as some useful mana and heavenly cooldown reduction.
Less CDR and armor than Heart, less damage than TF, the aoe field fucks up your lane control and cs. (it does not grant stack).

> [{quoted}](name=terkmc,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=9ulePHg7,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-29T01:22:00.709+0000)
>
> Less CDR and armor than Heart, less damage than TF, the aoe field fucks up your lane control and cs. (it does not grant stack).

Interesting points.

Also, good point bringing up trinity force. Great item on Nasus, if you can afford it (you want to focus on essentials at first)

The thing is that slows don't stack that well because movement speed hard and soft caps and because they stack multiplicative
And Trinity force gives Nasus some sticking power in the movement speed and Phage effect
And if you run 5% CDR in masteries and 5% CDR in runes then Frozen heart + Spirit Visage = 40% CDR
